definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: be weak, sick (NH id.; Aram. [[חֲלָא]] suffer (rare); As. ḫalû, sickness, grief, Dl:Pr 181)—

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Pf. ´[[ח]] 1Ki 14:1 + 8 t.; 2 fs. [[חָלִית]] Is 57:10; 1 S. [[חָלִיתִי]] 1Sa 30:13 + 2 t.; [[וְחָלִי֫תִי]] consec. Ju Jdg 16:7, Jdg 16:11, Jdg 16:17, [[חָלוּ֫]] Je 5:3 (so rd., v. infr.); Impf. [[וַיׇּ֫חַל]] 2Ki 1:2; Inf. sf. [[חֲלֽתוֹ]] Is 38:9; [[חֲלוֹתִי]] Ps 77:11 cf. sub

Pr 23:35, [[מַכָּה]] with [[חֳלִי]] De 28:59, De 28:61, Je 6:7, Je 10:19; hyperbol. sick from love [[חוֹלַת אַהֲבָה אני]] Ct So 2:5, So 5:8; be sick unto dying [[חלה לָמוּת]] 2Ki 20:1 = Is 38:1, [[עד־למות]]´[[ח]] (late) 2Ch 32:24; Je 5:3 rd. prob. definitions.title: Niph.
definitions.body: Am 6:6); of sickness of the mind in MT 1Sa 22:8 sq. [[עַל]] (but rd. rather [[חׂמֵל]] LXX Gr Klo Dr); pt. as adj. severe, sore [[רָעָה חוֹלָה]] Ec 5:12, Ec 5:15; —on Je 4:31 v. I. [[חול]].
make oneself sick, fig. for strain oneself Je 12:13 (but Gr [[נִלְאוּ]]).
be made sick Da 8:27; ´[[לאׁ נֶח]] of indifference, apathy Am 6:6 sq. [[על]] (cf.

definitions.title: Qal
definitions.body: Je 5:3); pt. diseased, as subst. c. art. Ez Eze 34:4 (del. Co) v:Eze 34:21; = severe, sore (pred. of [[מַכָּה]]) Na 3:19, Je 10:19, Je 14:17, Je 30:12; also ([[מַכָּה]] om.) Is 17:11.

definitions.title: Pi.
definitions.body: Pf. [[חִלָּה]] make sick, c. acc. cogn. + [[בְּ]] of land De 29:21; Inf. cstr. [[חַלּוֹתִי הִיא]] Ps 77:11 rd. prob. [[חֲלוֹתִי]] Inf. Qal; my sickness, so Bi Che (others der. fr. [[חלל]] my wounding, v. De).—For other forms of Pi. v. II. [[חלה]].

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pf. be made weak, 2 ms. [[חֻלֵּיתָ]] Is 14:10.

definitions.title: Hithp.
definitions.body: Impf. [[וַיִּתְחָָל]] 2Sa 13:6; Imv. [[הִתְחָָל]] 2Sa 13:5; Inf. [[הִתְחַלּוֹת]] 2Sa 13:2; —make oneself sick, of Ammon's morbid passion for his sister 2Sa 13:2, sq. [[בַּעֲבוּר]]; of his pretended sickness of body 2Sa 13:5, 2Sa 13:6.

make (sick, i.e.) sore thy smiting [[הַכּוֹתֶָךָ]] Mic 6:13 (cf. Na 3:19, Niph.); obj. (implic.) a person, [[חָפֵץ דַּכְּאוֹ]] ´[[וי]] [[הֶחֱלִי]] Is 53:10 it pleased ´[[י]] to bruise him, making him sick = to bruise him sorely, v. further Di.
make sick, obj. [[לֵב]] (of hope deferred) Pr 13:12.

shew (signs of) sickness, become sick, only [[שׂרים חֲמַת מִיׇּ֑יִן]] ´[[הֶח]] Ho 7:5 princes are become sick with fever of wine (Now Che VB; > Vrss Hi-St who rd. [[הֵחֵלּוּ]] they begin the day with wine-fever).
